Package org.world

Class GameObject

java.lang.Object
org.world.GameObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Enemy, NonSolidDecoration, Pickup, Player, Projectile, ScoreCounter, Shadow, SolidDecoration, StatBars, Tile, Weapon
public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>
Abstract class that sets the groundwork for the vast majority of objects making up a game world (level). Everything that can be interacted with during gameplay should be a descendant of this class. Each object is treated as a 3D box when it comes to collision calculations.

      Reference to the object that this one last collided with, useful in various cases

      Solid objects can take part in collisions, non-solid objects can be passed through by othero bjects

      Coordinate in the isometric system, used to identify which tile the game object is in

      Dimension of the game object on the x (left/right) axis, used for collision detection

    • zWidth

      public int zWidth
      Dimension of the game object on the z(up/down) axis, used for collision detection

    • remove

      public boolean remove
      Used to mark objects for removal from the game world. Marked objects wil be removed during the next update cycle

    • render

      public boolean render
      Flag marks whether object should be drawn to screen or not

    • spriteWidth

      public int spriteWidth
      Size of the sprite/texture, different from the size taken into account during collisions. Used for rendering.

    • spriteHeight

      public int spriteHeight
      Size of the sprite/texture, different from the size taken into account during collisions. Used for rendering.

    • rotation

      public int rotation
      Rotation of the object relative to the normal vertical(y) axis/ Values given in degrees/

    • animations

      public Animation[] animations
      Object's animation array

    • currentAnimation

      public int currentAnimation
      Index for the current animation. Used for animation switching.

    • currentFrame

      public int currentFrame
      Index of the current frame in the current animation. Can be accessed for actions that require exact frame timing (such as attacks).

    • previousAnimation

      protected int previousAnimation
      Saves the previous animation, the game object needs to know when it's animation has changed in order to start from the first frame

    • lastFrameTime

      private long lastFrameTime
      Saves the last time the current frame was changed. Used by playAnimation();

    • spriteSheetPath

      protected java.lang.String spriteSheetPath
      Relative path to the object's spritesheet/texture file. Example "/resources/player/player_anim.png"

    • flip

      protected boolean flip
      Flag marks whether the object's sprite should be mirrored when rendered to the screen. Helps with orienting objects left/right

    • GameObject

      public GameObject()

  • Method Details

    • distanceTo

      protected double distanceTo​(GameObject go)
      Computes the euclidean distance between this object and another given one
      Parameters:
      go - game object to calculate distance to
      Returns:
      distance as a double

    • distanceTo

      protected double distanceTo​(int x, int y, int z)
      Computes the distance from this object to a given point in the game world
      Parameters:
      x - coordinate of the point on the x axis
      y - coordinate of the point on the y axis
      z - coordinate of the point on the z axis
      Returns:
      distance as a double

    • loadAnimations

      protected void loadAnimations()
      Attempts to load the animations from the Animator class If no animation is present the reference is null after method call

    • createAnimations

      protected void createAnimations​(AnimationInformation[] animationInfo)
      Attempt to create the object's animations via the Animator's Animator.createAnimation(String, AnimationInformation[]) method. Also sets the current object's animations after their creation.
      Parameters:
      animationInfo - animationInformation array created from the object's animation enum

    • createTexture

      protected void createTexture()
      Attempt to create the object's texture via the Animator's Animator.createSingleTexture(String) method. Also sets the current object's animations after their creation. Used for objects that only have one static texture.

    • playAnimation

      protected void playAnimation()
      Increases the current frame when necessary depending on the animation's fps while accounting for it's loop property. See Animation.

    • update

      public abstract void update()
      Update method called each update cycle as long the object is still present in the game world Implemented in subclasses according to their respective needs

    • setFrame

      public void setFrame()
      This should be called for objects with more than 1 animation at the end of the update cycle. It sets the currentFrame to 0 when the previous animation differs from the current one, then saves the current animation in the previousAnimation variable for use next cycle. Therefore it ensures that animations always start with the first frame, and prevents array out of bounds errors in case of animations with different lengths

    • checkCollision

      public boolean checkCollision​(GameObject exception)
      Checks for collisions with nearby game objects. Each solid object has a "box" around it defined by its x,y,and z dimensions. This function checks if they overlap
      Parameters:
      exception - game object to ignore when considering collisions, can be occasionally useful

    • render

      public void render() throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      Renders the object when necessary, is overridden in some instances(ex. Player, Tiles) when more/different functionality is needed
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(GameObject go)
      //comparison for depth sorting when rendering
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>
      Parameters:
      go - object to be compared to
      Returns:
      greater than 0 if current object is behind go, 0 if they are at the same depth, less than 0 if the current object is in front
